verses.verse: Adulterers and adulteresses! Do you not know that (Rom. 8:7; 1 John 2:15) friendship with the world is enmity with God? (Gal. 1:4) Whoever therefore wants to be a friend of the world makes himself an enemy of God.
Or do you think that the Scripture says in vain, (Gen. 6:5) “The Spirit who dwells in us yearns jealously”?
But He gives more grace. Therefore He says: (Job 22:29; Ps. 138:6; Prov. 3:34; Matt. 23:12; 1 Pet. 5:5) “God resists the proud, But gives grace to the humble.”
(Humility Cures Worldliness) Therefore submit to God. ((Eph. 4:27; 6:11); 1 Pet. 5:8) Resist the devil and he will flee from you.

(2 Chr. 15:2; Zech. 1:3; Mal. 3:7; Heb. 7:19) Draw near to God and He will draw near to you. (Job 17:9; Is. 1:16; 1 Tim. 2:8) Cleanse your hands, you sinners; and (Jer. 4:14; James 3:17; 1 Pet. 1:22; 1 John 3:3) purify your hearts, you double-minded.
(Matt. 5:4) Lament and mourn and weep! Let your laughter be turned to mourning and your joy to gloom.
(Job 22:29; Luke 14:11; 18:14; 1 Pet. 5:6) Humble yourselves in the sight of the Lord, and He will lift you up.

(Do Not Judge a Brother) (2 Cor. 12:20; Eph. 4:31; James 5:9; 1 Pet. 2:1-3) Do not speak evil of one another, brethren. He who speaks evil of a brother ((Matt. 7:1-5); Rom. 14:4) and judges his brother, speaks evil of the law and judges the law. But if you judge the law, you are not a doer of the law but a judge.
There is one Lawgiver, ((Matt. 10:28)) who is able to save and to destroy. (Rom. 14:4) Who are you to judge another?
(Do Not Boast About Tomorrow) Come now, you who say, “Today or tomorrow we will go to such and such a city, spend a year there, buy and sell, and make a profit”;
whereas you do not know what will happen tomorrow. For what is your life? (Job 7:7; Ps. 102:3; 1 Pet. 1:24) It is even a vapor that appears for a little time and then vanishes away.
Instead you ought to say, (Acts 18:21; 1 Cor. 4:19) “If the Lord wills, we shall live and do this or that.”
But now you boast in your arrogance. (1 Cor. 5:6) All such boasting is evil.
Therefore, ((Luke 12:47); John 9:41; 2 Pet. 2:21) to him who knows to do good and does not do it, to him it is sin.
(Rich Oppressors Will Be Judged) Come now, you (Prov. 11:28; (Luke 6:24; 1 Tim. 6:9)) rich, weep and howl for your miseries that are coming upon you!
Your (Jer. 17:11; Matt. 6:19) riches are corrupted, and (Job 13:28) your garments are moth-eaten.
Your gold and silver are corroded, and their corrosion will be a witness against you and will eat your flesh like fire. (Rom. 2:5) You have heaped up treasure in the last days.

Indeed (Lev. 19:13; Job 24:10; Jer. 22:13; Mal. 3:5) the wages of the laborers who mowed your fields, which you kept back by fraud, cry out; and (Ex. 2:23; Deut. 24:15; Job 31:38) the cries of the reapers have reached the ears of the Lord of Sabaoth.
You have lived on the earth in pleasure and luxury; you have fattened your hearts as in a day of slaughter.
You have condemned, you have murdered the just; he does not resist you.
